meanings.definition: Used to express sorrow or regret.
meanings.sent1: Ochone! I forgot to bring my lunch to school today.
meanings.sent2: She exclaimed, 'Ochone, I wish I had studied more for the test.'
meanings.sent3: Ochone, I accidentally spilled juice on my new shirt.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathered above, echoing the ochone of the wind.
meanings.sent5: The old man's ochone echoed through the empty streets, a sound of deep sorrow.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of grief or lamentation.
meanings.sent1: Ochone! Why did the cookie jar have to fall and break?
meanings.sent2: The villagers cried out in unison, 'Ochone, our crops have withered.'
meanings.sent3: Ochone, the cat knocked over the vase again.
meanings.sent4: The lonely howl of the wolf carried an ochone across the silent night.
meanings.sent5: The haunting ochone of the banshee sent shivers down their spines.
